Simulation¶

mod

biosim.simulation provides the user with the interface to the package.

The simulation will run for a given number of years. The user will also be able to visualize the simulation results while the simulation is in progress. The visualization is given in one graphics window with the following elements:

  • Geography of the island is shown with color codes for the different landscape types.

  • Line graph that shows the total number of animals in the island by species.

  • Population map with color bars that shows how many animals per species there are in each cell.

This file can be imported as a module and contains the following class:

  • BioSim - Simulation interface module

Note

  • This script requires that pandas, matplotlib and numpy is installed within the Python environment you are running this script in. Also requires ffmpeg.

class biosim.simulation.BioSim(island_map=None, ini_pop=None, seed=1, ymax_animals=None, cmax_animals=None, img_base=None, img_fmt=None)[source]¶

Simulation interface class.

Parameters

  • island_map (str) – Multi-line string specifying island geography

  • ini_pop (list) – List of dictionaries specifying initial population

  • seed (int) – Random number seed

  • ymax_animals (int) – y-axis limit for graph showing animal numbers

  • cmax_animals (dict) – Color-code limits for animal densities, e.g. {‘Herbivore’: 100, ‘Carnivore’: 50}

  • img_base (str) – Beginning of file name for figures, including path If img_base is None, no figures are written to file.

  • img_fmt (str) – File type for figures, e.g. ‘png’

static set_animal_parameters(species, params)[source]¶

Set parameters for animal species.

Parameters

  • species (str) – Name of animal species

  • params (dict) – Valid parameter specification for species

static set_landscape_parameters(landscape, params)[source]¶

Set parameters for landscape type.

Parameters

  • landscape (str) – Letter code for landscape

  • params (dict) – Valid parameter specification for landscape

simulate(num_years, vis_years=1, img_years=None)[source]¶

Run simulation while visualizing the results.

Parameters

  • num_years (int) – Number of years to simulate

  • vis_years (int) – Years between visualization updates

  • img_years (int) – Years between visualizations saved to files (default: vis_years)

Note

Image files will be numbered consecutively.

add_population(population)[source]¶

Adds a population to the island.

Parameters

population (list) – List of dictionaries specifying population

property nested_coordinates_list¶

Makes a nested list with None as values, with indexing corresponding to the coordinates of the island map.

type

list

property year¶

Last year simulated.

Type

int

property num_animals¶

Finds total number of animals on island.

Type

int

property num_animals_per_species¶

Finds total number of animals per species on the island.

Type

dict

property animal_distribution¶

Makes a pandas DataFrame with animal count per species for each cell on the island.

type

pandas.DataFrame

make_movie()[source]¶

Creates mp4 movie from visualization images saved.

The movie is stored as img_base + movie_fmt 2.

References¶

1

Kington, J. (2016). Using numpy to interpolate gaps. [Source code from Stack Overflow].

2

Plesser, H. E. (2018). Randvis project. [Source code on GitHub].
